content.description: AKA “Book of Dread.” 140ft to gear anchor. Starts on broken face and easy ledges and moves into right facing dihedral with hand sized crack. Protects well. Short easy chimney/offwidth at top that can be avoided by climbing face to the right. Save larger gear for protecting inside the offwidth. Intermediate 3 bolt anchor allows this to be done in two pitches. This route is particularly prone to small rock fall directly onto the belayer. Wear helmets and be careful of loose rock.
content.protection: Gear to #4. 3 bolt anchor mid-way. Gear anchor at top.
content.location: Name painted as “8 Heartbreaker.” Two rappels or walk off to climber's left.

content.description: Blocky climbing in left facing corner. Named "fragile rock" for good reason. While most of the rock has been cleaned by previous climbers, belayer should wear a helmet.

Fun movement on small edges and jugs. 140ft to two bolt anchor above the lip. Very dirty and has moss growing in patches over the route. Evidence of recent rock-fall and exfoliation. Check all holds before committing. One glue-in bolt midway up has been smashed by rock-fall. Still usable but suspect.
content.protection: Bolts and small to medium gear. Two bolt anchor at top.
content.location: Between 10 and 11, unmarked. Two rope rappel or walk off to climber's left, no mid-way anchor.

content.description:
Also known as Leg Breaker in honor of C/Sgt Tinsley, who was a British Royal Marine mountain leader exchange instructor in the early 90s. He took a whipper mid-way up and hit the overhang with his leg, breaking his tibia. To add insult to injury, he re-broke the leg when dropping into a telemark turn at Mammoth the following winter.

Climb cracks and edges to roof. Climb the roof on the left side on good holds. The route meanders generally straight up on small edges and cracks. The face gets smoother and more moss covered closer to the top, but is well protected with small gear and bolts.
content.protection: Bolts and small gear. Gear anchor at the top or a good tree can be reached with a 70m rope.
content.location: Name painted at the start of the route as “7 (Leg Breaker) Medal of Honor.” Walk off to climbers left. Two 60m ropes from the tree will NOT reach the base.

content.description: Follow the easy, broken, left-leaning crack system to the top.
content.location: Painted as “10 Crows Nest.” Double rappel Heartbreaker or walk off to left.
